column2: After three centuries of rule, the Abbasid Caliphate is losing its hold on Persia and the Levant. Various Persian dynasties compete with each other for dominance, unaware of the Seljuks waiting to unite Islam under Turkish rule. Meanwhile, the Abbasid decline provides an opportunity for Byzantine territories to be reclaimed by future emperors. In Europe, Henry the Fowler will soon leave his throne to the future Otto the Great, Norway is ruled by a Christian king, and Abd-ar-Rahman III guides Cordoba through its golden age as a self-declared Caliph and Commander of the Faithful.
